contents.Text: [[[hyperlink:Yt-dlp][https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp]]]is a external program used to download and parse certain information

contents.Header2: Why use yt-dlp instead of making my own?

contents.Text: Yt-dlp has thousands of people working on it to keep it up to date one sole developer could never do this
that is why for flexibility for supported websites yt-dlp is used
and this will keep this program relevant for a long time
Args are passed to yt-dlp in order for it to know what/how to download
Here are links to pages in yt-dlp wiki to read args
•[[[hyperlink:Usage and Options][https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp?tab=readme-ov-file#usage-and-options]]]- Used to get a idea of how it works

•[[[hyperlink:Output Template][https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp?tab=readme-ov-file#output-template]]]- Used to specify a folders output format (Warning about removing the id at the end of the template this is used in the deduplicate detector)
•[[[hyperlink:Post-processing Options][https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp?tab=readme-ov-file#post-processing-options]]]- Used to show more flags useful to understand structure of the default args
From this point onwards it assumes you have used yt-dlp before and understand how to interface with it
now the next best thing to do is look at the default args in the settings menu
then look at the args on the site and add or remove args you want to add with testing in commandline/terminal before hand
this allows you to be able to customize the args to fit your needs you can even hardcode formats into the args
so you can download mp3 using -f mp4 in the args as a example then use that on a playlist you want to download in mp4
